options: Using too fine a time step in simulation
questions.correctAnswer: Using too fine a time step in simulation
questions.explanation: Using too fine a time step would make the simulation more accurate, not less. The 50% error suggests missing physics (parasitic C), measurement issues (probe loading), or parameter errors.
questions.prompt: Simulation predicts bandwidth = 10 MHz, measurement shows 5 MHz. Which is LEAST likely to be the cause?
